description:
on 5 June the Nauru parliament passed an amendment to the National Disaster Risk Management Bill 2020. More  offences  have  been  included  such  as  uttering, publishing or posting messages on social or mass media and to cause fear or mislead the public as well as distorting official information. Police are given powers to act without a warrant, as disasters may not permit time to request a warrant. 
This does not reference covid-19 but appear to be related to combatting fake news.
date_end_spec: The policy has an unlimited time span (e.g. recommendation to wash one's hands; passing of a legal bill)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
compliance: Mandatory (Other; please list other enforcement mechanisms in the text entry)

description:
As Nauru has remained Covid-19 free, schools have remained open during this period. On 20 April, parents and teachers were advised that Term 2 will go ahead as normal, beginning 21 April, unless the situation changes. 

Children now taught about hygiene and how to prevent the spread of covid-19. UPDATE: While schools remain open, children are being taught about hygiene through posters, poems and even craft activities during term 2 (April-June).

description: On 4-5 June the Nauru parliament discussed that The  Curriculum  unit  progresses  to  prepare  the delivery  of primary and secondary learning through other modes and means for our students should the need to work from home becomes a necessity. description:
Nauruan government declared a 30 day state of emergency on March 16 2020, effective immediately. 

The state of emergency ended 13 April 2020. As of 1 July 2020, there have been no cases on Nauru. UPDATE: State of emergency was declared from 16 March and due to end on 13 April. Nauru has had no cases of Covid 19 (as of 1 July 2020). The state of emergency was no extended.

description:
Timor-Leste will temporarily close its borders and no longer allow travelers, regardless of citizenship, to enter or exit the country beginning April 13 until further notice.  Exemptions will require approval from the Prime Minister’s Office.
Foreigners are no longer authorized to enter Timor-Leste.  Exceptions include permanent residents of Timor-Leste, those who were born in Timor-Leste, those responsible for transporting and releasing goods (with restrictions to remain in the “international zone” of airports, seaports, and land borders), those who are legal representatives of Timorese minors, and those who work on oil rigs in the Timor Sea.  The Prime Minister may allow additional exemptions on a case-by-case basis. UPDATE: Timor-Leste will temporarily close its borders and no longer allow travelers, regardless of citizenship, to enter or exit the country beginning April 13 until further notice.  Exceptions include permanent residents of Timor-Leste, those who were born in Timor-Leste, those responsible for transporting and releasing goods those who are legal representatives of Timorese minors, and those who work on oil rigs in the Timor Sea.  The Prime Minister may allow additional exemptions on a case-by-case basis.

description:
The government of Nauru announced on 4 August that due to a travel restriction by Australia limiting the number of incoming passengers per flight to 30 has instigated an additional charter flight to/from Brisbane each fortnight.

The extra passenger flight is being chartered by Canstruct and will operate Saturdays – arriving at 2am and will commence this weekend. The additional flight will enable Canstruct to better manage its staff rotation.
type_sub_cat: Other External Border Restriction
target_geog_level: One or more countries and one or more regional groupings

description:
On March 18, 2020, the Nauru government suspends most flights inbound and outbound for unspecified period. One flight to Brisbane to Nauru return will operate on Friday's on a fortnightly basis from 20 March. All flights to Fiji are cancelled. 

This policy ended when the Nauru government announced an additional flight from/to Brisbane. UPDATE: As of 4 August, the Nauru government announced that there would no longer be just one flight per fortnight between Nauru and Brisbane, but two. This is because a limit of 30 passengers per day has been set by the Australian government, meaning fewer Nauruans can travel to Australia per flight.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
type_sub_cat: Total border crossing ban
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: As part of the new covid-19 regulations, Nauruans will be subject to contract tracing which is the tracing of the movement of a person suspected with, or has coronavirus required to be undertaken by authorities to find out and see who that person might have been in contact with – and potentially passing on the virus to others.For  the  purpose  of  public  health  and  safety,  contact  tracing  may  be  conducted.For  this  reason  a  list  may  be  compiled  containing  names,  families,  households,  workplaces  and  other  places.  The  record  will  comply  with the confidentiality requirements of a medical patient except for any lawful purpose including those under the Regulations.A  potentially  infectious  person  will  be  directed  to  reside  in  a  designated residence. Police and authorised officers may use force if the person fails to comply.Fines  and  jail  term  are  penalties  for  failure  to  comply,  including  an  additional  continual  daily  penalty  of  $1,000  until  the  initial  penalty  of $5,000 is paid.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: A report from 11 May, suggests it is not clear who is responsible for refugees detained on Nauru as part of the Australian Government offshore refugee processing policy. Australian Border Force officials have reportedly not responded about if it would be the Nauruan or Australian Governments responsible for caring for the refugees if they contracted Covid-19.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: ON 24 March, Nauru government announced that Taiwan would be providing a testing machine for Covid-19 meaning that tests would no longer have to be flown to Australia for processing which could take up to 2 weeks now, as flights have been reduced. Taiwan was also one of the countries that incoming passengers to Nauru were allowed to have transited through. All other Asian countries were identified as restricted countries and those who had travelled through them in the past 21 days were not allowed to board a flight to Nauru.
type_sub_cat: Public Testing Facilities (e.g. drive-in testing for COVID-19)
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries
target_province: Taiwan (as politically a part of China)

description: Announced on 24 March, Nauru unveiled a new thermal imager at Nauru  International  Airport,  which  will  detect high body temperatures or fever in incoming passengers, 12 March.The scanner is one of the health department’s line of defence in identifying possible introduction of the Coronavirus into Nauru.Early detection means early containment and mitigation of any spread of COVID-19 in our community.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
enforcer: Other (Please specify in the text box)

description:
On 14 May, Nauru's Covid-19 taskforce staged a first coronavirus emergency services drill. 

Emergency services, police, health, IHMS, security providers, multicultural   affairs   representatives   along   with   messaging   channels Government Information Office (GIO), Nauru Media and  Digicel,  came  together  to  enact  ‘Scenario  1:  uncontrolled  breakout into the community’ following  the group’s three-day COVID  strategic  response  planning  workshop  the  previous  week. Stakeholders worked together, 6-8 May, to develop a coordinated plan to strategically navigate through the scenario, which began as a ‘desktop’ solution they then honed and perfected, and later practiced  and  rehearsed  before  it  was  enacted  on  the  day  as  a  live drill.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
